did.unittitle: Letters
Theodore Dreiser, New York, to Will M. Clemons 1898 Jun 8

scopecontent.p: Writes two years before publication of his first book; discusses his connection with Ev'ry Month; recalls material submitted to the magazine, which he does not know if they used.

did.unittitle: Theodore Dreiser, Philadelphia, to Duffy 1903 Jan 6

scopecontent.p: Includes 2 typed copies; writes about friends and family; plans to go to New York one day with a completed novel and ideas that will "shake the universe"; mentions Norman Duncan, Sister Carrie, and The Soul of the Street.

did.unittitle: Theodore Dreiser, New York, to F. G. Moorhead, Des Moines, Iowa 1909 Apr 5

scopecontent.p: Offers $75 for "Farming DeLuxe" article; intends to use piece in The Designer, but cannot use it in The Delineator; believes Moorhead could write and interesting article on "Farming for Women."

did.unittitle: Theodore Dreiser, New York, to Professor J. L. Randolph, [Virginia Polytechnic Institute] 1909 Sep 16

scopecontent.p: Invites him to contribute to The Delineator or The New Idea, both of which Dreiser edits; writes that his publications have a circulation of 10,000; asks for suggestions for other contributors.

did.unittitle: Theodore Dreiser, New York, to Edgar Jepson, English novelist 1910 Oct 11

scopecontent.p: Thanks him for kind words regarding Sister Carrie; mentions Gathroyal Gardens, The Delineator, and Tourie; plans to bring [Jennie Gerhardt] out in England.

did.unittitle: Theodore Dreiser, New York, to Nat Kolz 1914 Feb 2

scopecontent.p: Expresses gratitude for dinner.

did.unittitle: Theodore Dreiser, New York, to Miss Wright 1919 Mar 17

scopecontent.p: Autographs Jennie Gerhardt; thanks her for sincere appreciation; mentions "Old Neil House."

did.unittitle: Theodore Dreiser, New York, to Symon Gould, New York 1919 Sep 15

scopecontent.p: Intends to include suggested changes to [The Hand of the Potter] in the second edition;mentions his story in the October issue of Smart Set and a review by George Jean Nathan of The Hand of the Potter.

did.unittitle: Theodore Dreiser, Los Angeles, to David F. Karsner, New York 1920 Dec 12

scopecontent.p: Thanks him for The Call; agrees with his article "If the Light Should Go Out"; complains about intellectuals; values Lenin and Trotzky greatly over Wells or Wallings.

did.unittitle: Theodore Dreiser, New York, to Blodgett 1922 Dec 12

scopecontent.p: Thanks him for letter written to Chicago Daily News on Dreiser's behalf.

did.unittitle: Theodore Dreiser, New York, to Ernest Boyd, New York 1923 Jan 15

scopecontent.p: Invites him to join [H. L.] Mencken, Sherwood Anderson, A. A. Bull and Tom Smith for a visit.

did.unittitle: Theodore Dreiser, New York, to George Sterling 1924 Aug 21

scopecontent.p: Mentions Dreiser's refusal to look at the work of a young writer, Dr. Abrams, Helen, and Llewellyn Powys.

did.unittitle: Theodore Dreiser, New York, to Ernest Boyd, New York 1925 Apr 16

scopecontent.p: Invites him to a "Beer drinking adventure" in Brooklyn, at the home of Kenneth Hayes Miller with Ed Smith, [H. L.] Mencken, de Sanchez and others.

did.unittitle: Theodore Dreiser to Frank [ca. 1926-27]

scopecontent.p: Mentions reproductions of paintings and Moods.

did.unittitle: Theodore Dreiser to William Woodward 1927 Jul 27

scopecontent.p: Accepts invitation for following week; mentions carpentry on Mt. Kisco cabin; asks for directions.

did.unittitle: Theodore Dreiser to William Woodward 1928 Mar 23

scopecontent.p: Accepts invitation; discusses painful gathering of articles.

did.unittitle: Theodore Dreiser, New York, to a book shop 1928 Apr 4

scopecontent.p: Requests that a copy of bibliography of his works be forwarded to Otto Kyllmann, president of Constable & Co., his publisher.

did.unittitle: Theodore Dreiser, New York, to John Cowper Powys 1928 Oct 22

scopecontent.p: Plans to return to cabin on December 16; discusses improvements on cabin; mentions Phyllis and Valley Forge.

did.unittitle: Theodore Dreiser, New York, to Margaret Monahan, New York 1929 Jan 9

scopecontent.p: Thanks her for list; advises her to get someone to clarify her English before sending manuscript to publisher; plans to discuss her work in person; requests to copy of next revision.

did.unittitle: Theodore Dreiser, New York, to John Cowper Powys 1930 Nov 26

scopecontent.p: Discusses [Charles Hoy] Fort's book; asks for Powys' opinion.

did.unittitle: Theodore Dreiser, New York, to John Cowper Powys 1930 Dec 12

scopecontent.p: Mentions Fortean Society, Mr. Fort, and Powys' letter.

did.unittitle: Theodore Dreiser, New York, to John Cowper Powys 1931 Dec 21

scopecontent.p: Believes he is finally cured of stomach ulcers.

did.unittitle: Theodore Dreiser, New York, to John Cowper Powys 1932 Sep 8

scopecontent.p: Describes purpose of The American Spectator, a monthly edited by Dreiser and others; invites him to submit a piece, which will be printed as written for $.01 a word.

did.unittitle: Theodore Dreiser, Mt. Kisco, New York, to John Cowper Powys 1932 Sep 29

scopecontent.p: Likes his article very much; writes that there is no room for it in the current issue.

did.unittitle: Theodore Dreiser, New York, to John Cowper Powys, Hillsdale, New York 1932 Nov 21

scopecontent.p: Writes that Boyd, Nathan, Cabell, and O'Neill would not accept his article; mentions The Spectator.

did.unittitle: Theodore Dreiser, New York, to Frank C. Dodd, New York 1934 Apr 30

scopecontent.p: Expresses thanks.

did.unittitle: Theodore Dreiser, New York, to Clark 1938 Oct 3

scopecontent.p: Mentions Bye, John Wheeler, the Syndicate, book of 12 stories, and writing an introduction.

did.unittitle: Theodore Dreiser, New York, to Clark 1938 Oct 20

scopecontent.p: Asserts that 6 of the stories are okay and will go to Gingrich with Dreiser's endorsement; requests he send all of the stories.

did.unittitle: Theodore Dreiser, New York, to Theodore Fred Kuper, New York 1944 Apr 14

scopecontent.p: Thanks him for forwarding Claude Bowers letter, which Dreiser has just answered.

did.unittitle: Miscellaneous
Various clippings 1898 Jan

scopecontent.p: Includes: article by Theodore Dreiser on Joseph Choate, 1 p., from Success, January, 1898; "A Talk with America's Leading Author, or What Success Means," 2 p. with illustration; articles on "The Great Harbor Improvement," New York Herald, 1881, July 25 and other dates, with discussion of Sandy Hook bar and deepening of ship channels; "The Evolution of the Typewriter," 8 page reprint from Bedford's, April, 1892; "The Sailor's Harbor" by Mrs. R. F. Woodward, 9 pages with photos.

did.unittitle: Reviews 1839 Mar 8

scopecontent.p: Cover review from New York Times Book Review Magazine by Maxwell Geisman; review of The Letters of Theodore Dreiser, edited by Robert H. Elias with photos, from the University of Pennsylvania Library.
